statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ 2 \\ -2 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 1 \\ 4 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -8 \\ 4 \\ -4 \\ -10 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -29 \\ 13 \\ -8 \\ -29 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ 4 \\ 1 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] span or don't span \mathbb{R}^4.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ 2 \\ -2 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 1 \\ 4 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -8 \\ 4 \\ -4 \\ -10 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -29 \\ 13 \\ -8 \\ -29 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ 4 \\ 1 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] do not span \mathbb{R}^4.
